main event: On November 13, 1957, in Cleburne, Texas, a ground-radar observation reported an oval-shaped, silver-colored object with the sound of a distant plane. The observation lasted approximately 10 minutes from 1:44 to 1:54 AM.
interesting points: The object was picked up on ground radar and estimated to be 3 miles away, moving in the opposite direction of Dallas-Ft. Worth Airport.
The object was described as oval-shaped and silver-colored, resembling a distant plane in sound.
The observation lasted for 10 minutes, providing a significant duration for analysis.
The witness reported a clear weather condition with slight wind, adding credibility to the observation.
Photographs were taken and included in the report, adding visual evidence to the sighting.
